p: Knowledge of emergency call did not differ between the two groups (92 % in trained group vs 86 % in non-trained group, p = 0.2). Hands were more often properly placed during chest compression in the trained-group (92 % vs 73 %, p = 0.002). Electrodes of automated external defibrillator were more often properly placed in the trained-group (44 % vs 10 %, p = 0.0001).
